intro: Antirhea microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved antirhea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
